intro: Cacalia hypochaeris, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cacalia hypochaeris is adapted to a variety of soil types and thrives in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides.
